item.title: Flags attached to street lights, making me feel unsafe, 25th August
item.description:
Flags have been attached overnight to several street lights in the Central reservation of Tewkesbury road, by the garage and Lidl. I am white British, but I find this display not only breaks the law, but is also intimidating as a symbol if the far right. There must be cctv footage available to prosecute the offenders.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tewkesbury Road, Kingsditch, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadwork Signs Incorrectly Placed and Wrong Information, 24th August
item.description:
The signs indicating the road closure on North Place are incorrectly positioned. Traffic approaching the junction of North Place and Swindon Road from the West are only aware of the roadworks when the sign around the corner into North Place becomes visible. By then, drivers are, either, committed and have to u-turn or attempt to turn back into traffic. However, traffic approaching from the East on Fairview Road have signs indicating that North Place is closed with a sign indicating roadworks and an arrow indicating right. These signs are wrongly positioned and irrelevant as it already a No Right Turn into North Place from Fairview Road. These signs need to be repositioned to the West of the junction to correctly advise drivers of the closed road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fairview Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Information board identifying emergency contact company/number not displayed

item.title: 5 tyres in the ditch, 24th August
item.description:
Heading right from the A38, along the b4123, there are 5 used car tyres located within the ditch, 50 yards of the road sign with deer Hurs/ oddas chapel. Use the coordinates 51.9591766, -2.1687316
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): B4213, Deerhurst, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Cracks along footpath on the green at top of Lavender Road / Bluebell Road, 24th August
item.description:
On the footpath that runs across the green at the top of Lavender Road / Bluebell Road. The cracks run for several metres along the path. There are long cracks in the footpath surface which have been noticeable for the past few weeks and seem to have worsened during the hot weather. The gaps are wide enough that a dog’s paw could get caught and they could also catch a bicycle wheel. The path is still usable but it would be safer if repaired before it deteriorates further. Photos attached show the damage.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 39, Lavender Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface

item.title: Electric Scooters - Parking completely blocking footpath, 24th August
item.description:
The bank of scooters that are parked outside Cheltenham train station opposite Tesco Express. This completely blocks my ability to get a baby pushchair through, it’s also difficult crossing. I have a blind neighbour who I have seen walking that route which is bound to be difficult for her guide dog to navigate safely. I have attached a photo for record.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 77, Queen's Road, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Other damage to pavement i.e. cobbles, raised mound/surface
